page.title: 03FARMING AROUND ROTHWELL
page.content: Most of the area is semi-rural.There are pockets of habitation with many outlaying farms. The majority of farms grow cereal crops. One or two however are dairy farms which grow their own barley to support their livestock. The area is famous for rhubarb cultivation being very close to the 'Rhubarb triangle'. There are forcing sheds to enable the farmers to provide rhubarb throughout the year. This rhubarb is forced and picked by candlelight to help its development. Rhubarb is also grown in rotation in the fields for later crops. In the South Eastern part of the area there is oil seed rape which at present also supports honeybees as a secondary product. Certain farms are geared to vegetable and market garden produce with small farm shops providing fresh vegetables for customers from Leeds and Wakefield
